Extraction of Keyphrases from Text: Evaluation of Four Algorithms
ERB-1051
October 23, 1997
Abstract
This report presents an empirical evaluation of four algorithms for automatically extracting
keywords and keyphrases from documents. The four algorithms are compared using five dif-
ferent collections of documents. For each document, we have a target set of keyphrases, which
were generated by hand. The target keyphrases were generated for human readers; they were
not tailored for any of the four keyphrase extraction algorithms. Each of the algorithms was
evaluated by the degree to which the algorithm's keyphrases matched the manually generated
keyphrases. The four algorithms were (1) the AutoSummarize feature in Microsoft's Word 97,
(2) an algorithm based on Eric Brill's part-of-speech tagger, (3) the Summarize feature in Ver-
ity's Search 97, and (4) NRC's Extractor algorithm. For all five document collections, NRC's
Extractor yields the best match with the manually generated keyphrases. 1
